BloodTestParameters.Name: Hemoglobin (Hb)
BloodTestParameters.About: A protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body.

Foods.Dos: Consume iron-rich foods like red meat, beans, and spinach; vitamin C-rich foods to enhance iron absorption.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive caffeine and calcium during iron-rich meals as they can inhibit absorption.

Exercises.Dos: Moderate aerobic exercises like walking, jogging, and cycling; strength training to improve oxygen utilization.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid extreme endurance exercises that could exacerbate anemia.

BloodTestParameters.Name: White Blood Cell (WBC) Count
BloodTestParameters.About: Cells that are part of the immune system and help fight infections.

CausesEffects.LowWBC: Increased risk of infections, bone marrow problems, autoimmune diseases.

Foods.Dos: Eat vitamin C-rich foods like oranges and strawberries; zinc-rich foods like beef and shellfish.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive alcohol and sugary foods that can suppress immune function.

Exercises.Dos: Regular moderate exercise like brisk walking, swimming, and yoga.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid overtraining and extremely strenuous activities that can suppress the immune system.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Platelet Count
BloodTestParameters.About: Cells that help with blood clotting and wound healing.

CausesEffects.HighPlatelets: Risk of blood clots, thrombocytosis, cardiovascular events.
CausesEffects.LowPlatelets: Increased risk of bleeding, bruising, petechiae.

Foods.Dos: Eat vitamin K-rich foods like leafy greens; omega-3 fatty acids from fish and flaxseeds.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive alcohol and processed foods.

Exercises.Dos: Low-impact exercises like walking and swimming; gentle stretching and yoga.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid contact sports and high-impact activities that can cause injury.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Total Cholesterol
BloodTestParameters.About: A measure of the total amount of cholesterol in your blood, including LDL and HDL.

CausesEffects.HighCholesterol: Increased risk of heart disease, stroke, and atherosclerosis.
CausesEffects.LowCholesterol: Rare, but can be related to malnutrition or liver disease.

Foods.Dos: Eat foods high in soluble fiber like oats and beans; healthy fats like avocados and nuts.
Foods.Donts: Avoid trans fats and excessive saturated fats found in fried and processed foods.

Exercises.Dos: Cardiovascular exercises like running, cycling, and swimming; resistance training.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Fasting Blood Glucose
BloodTestParameters.About: A measure of the glucose levels in your blood after fasting for at least 8 hours.

CausesEffects.HighBloodGlucose: Diabetes, increased risk of cardiovascular disease, nerve damage.

Foods.Dos: Eat low glycemic index foods like whole grains and non-starchy vegetables; lean proteins.
Foods.Donts: Avoid sugary snacks, refined carbs, and excessive alcohol.

Exercises.Dos: Aerobic exercises like brisk walking, jogging, and dancing; strength training.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Creatinine
BloodTestParameters.About: A waste product from muscle metabolism that is filtered by the kidneys.

CausesEffects.LowCreatinine: Low muscle mass, certain muscle diseases.

Foods.Dos: Stay hydrated with plenty of water; reduce protein intake if levels are high (consult a doctor).
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive protein and salt intake.

Exercises.Dos: Moderate aerobic exercises like walking and cycling.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid excessive high-intensity exercises if creatinine is high.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Vitamin D
BloodTestParameters.About: A vitamin that helps with calcium absorption and bone health.

CausesEffects.HighVitaminD: Hypercalcemia, causing nausea, weakness, kidney problems.
CausesEffects.LowVitaminD: Bone pain, muscle weakness, increased risk of fractures.

Foods.Dos: Eat fatty fish like salmon; fortified foods like milk and cereals.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive intake of vitamin D supplements without medical advice.

Exercises.Dos: Outdoor activities like walking or running to get sunlight exposure; weight-bearing exercises.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid excessive sun exposure without protection.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Calcium
BloodTestParameters.About: A mineral essential for bone health, muscle function, and nerve signaling.

CausesEffects.HighCalcium: Hypercalcemia, leading to kidney stones, bone pain, abdominal pain.

Foods.Dos: Eat dairy products like milk, cheese, yogurt; leafy greens and fortified plant-based milk.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive caffeine and high-sodium foods.

Exercises.Dos: Weight-bearing exercises like walking, jogging, dancing; strength training.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid high-impact activities that may cause fractures if bones are weak.

BloodTestParameters.Name: Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone (TSH)
BloodTestParameters.About: A hormone that stimulates the thyroid gland to produce thyroid hormones.

CausesEffects.HighTSH: Hypothyroidism, causing fatigue, weight gain, depression.
CausesEffects.LowTSH: Hyperthyroidism, leading to weight loss, rapid heart rate, anxiety.

Foods.Dos: Consume iodine-rich foods like fish and dairy; selenium-rich foods like Brazil nuts.
Foods.Donts: Avoid excessive soy products and goitrogenic foods like raw cruciferous vegetables if you have thyroid issues.

Exercises.Dos: Regular moderate exercise like walking and swimming; yoga.
Exercises.Donts: Avoid extreme physical stress and high-intensity workouts if thyroid function is imbalanced.
